thesis.description: Red clover (Trifolium pratense L.) is one of the most important and most widely grown cultivated legumes in Canada. The early flowering varieties are the most popular in the clover growing areas of Quebec, Ontario and the Maritime provinces because they are able to make a rapid recovery after the first cutting. Red clover is subject to numerous diseases and insects, some of which cause severe injury to the plant, while others inhibit plant growth and thus reduce the yield or quality of the bay.
thesis.creator: Smith, Thomas. H.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: Auxins and disease in red clover roots.
